org.modelio.vbasic.files

Class FileUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.modelio.vbasic.files.FileUtils

  • public final class FileUtils
extends Object
    This class consists exclusively of static methods that operate on files, directories, or other types of files.

    This class uses Files that give better diagnostics on failure than File.

    Note: Most of the methods may throw a FileSystemException. Its getMessage() method usually does not return a user friendly message. Use getLocalizedMessage(FileSystemException) to get a user friendly error message.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  FileUtils.CopyDirVisitor
      Visitor that copies a directory to another path.

    • Method Detail

      • computeSize

        public static long computeSize(Path path)
                        throws IOException,
                               FileSystemException
        Compute the size of all files stored in a directory tree.
        Parameters:
        path - a directory path.
        Returns:
        the size of the directory.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs. call Throwable.getMessage() to get the error cause.
        FileSystemException - if a file system exception occurs. Note: getMessage() usually does not return a user friendly message. Call getLocalizedMessage(FileSystemException) to get a user friendly error message.

      • copyDirectoryTo

        public static void copyDirectoryTo(Path from,
                   Path toDir)
                            throws IOException,
                                   FileSystemException
        Copy recursively the given directory to (not into) the destination directory.

        The destination directory does not have to exist.

        Parameters:
        from - the directory to copy
        toDir - the directory copy path
        Throws:
        IOException - in case of failure
        FileSystemException - if a file system exception occurs. Note: getMessage() usually does not return a user friendly message. Call getLocalizedMessage(FileSystemException) to get a user friendly error message.

      • createDir

        public static void createDir(File dir)
                      throws InvalidPathException,
                             SecurityException,
                             IOException,
                             FileSystemException,
                             FileAlreadyExistsException
        Creates a directory by creating all nonexistent parent directories first. Unlike the createDirectory method, an exception is not thrown if the directory could not be created because it already exists.

        If this method fails, then it may do so after creating some, but not all, of the parent directories.

        Parameters:
        dir - the directory to create
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs. call Throwable.getMessage() to get the error cause.
        FileSystemException - if a file system exception occurs. Note: FileSystemException.getMessage() usually does not return a user friendly message. Call getLocalizedMessage(FileSystemException) to get a user friendly error message.
        SecurityException - in the case of the default provider, and a security manager is installed, the checkWrite method is invoked prior to attempting to create a directory and its checkRead is invoked for each parent directory that is checked. If dir is not an absolute path then its toAbsolutePath may need to be invoked to get its absolute path. This may invoke the security manager's checkPropertyAccess method to check access to the system property user.dir
        FileAlreadyExistsException - if dir exists but is not a directory (optional specific exception)
        InvalidPathException - - if a Path object cannot be constructed from the abstract path (see FileSystem.getPath)

      • delete

        public static void delete(Path path)
                   throws NoSuchFileException,
                          DirectoryNotEmptyException,
                          SecurityException,
                          IOException,
                          FileSystemException
        Deletes the given file or directory recursively.

        If the path denotes a directory, tries to delete it with all its content.

        Parameters:
        path - the path to the file or directory to delete
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs. call Throwable.getMessage() to get the error cause.
        FileSystemException - if a file system exception occurs. Note: FileSystemException.getMessage() usually does not return a user friendly message. Call getLocalizedMessage(FileSystemException) to get a user friendly error message.
        SecurityException - In the case of the default provider, and a security manager is installed, the SecurityManager.checkDelete(String) method is invoked to check delete access to the file
        DirectoryNotEmptyException - if the file is a directory and could not otherwise be deleted because the directory is not empty (optional specific exception)
        NoSuchFileException - if the file does not exist (optional specific exception)

      • delete

                   throws NoSuchFileException,
                          DirectoryNotEmptyException,
                          SecurityException,

        SecurityException - In the case of the default provider, and a security manager is installed, the SecurityManager.checkDelete(String) method is invoked to check delete access to the file
        DirectoryNotEmptyException - if the file is a directory and could not otherwise be deleted because the directory is not empty (optional specific exception)
        NoSuchFileException - if the file does not exist (optional specific exception)

        Deletes the given file or directory recursively.

      • encodeFileName

        public static StringBuilder encodeFileName(String s,
                           StringBuilder sb)
        Encode any string to a legal file name.

        Illegal characters are encoded by '%' followed by the hex value of the character.

        Parameters:
        s - a string to encode
        sb - the string builder to use to build the encoded string. The encoded file name will be appended to the buffer.
        Returns:
        the string builder for convenience.

      • decodeFileName

        public static StringBuilder decodeFileName(String fileName,
                           StringBuilder sb)
        Decode a string from a file name encoded with encodeFileName(String, StringBuilder).
        Parameters:
        fileName - a file name with/without extension
        sb - the string builder to use to build the decoded string. The decoded file name will be appended to the buffer.
        Returns:
        the string builder for convenience.

      • getLocalizedMessage

        public static String getLocalizedMessage(FileSystemException e)
        Compute and return a user friendly message from the given FileSystemException.
        Parameters:
        e - the exception.
        Returns:
        a message, won't be null.

      • getLocalizedMessage

        public static String getLocalizedMessage(IOException e)
        Compute and return a user friendly message from the given IOException.

        Delegates to getLocalizedMessage(FileSystemException) if the parameter is a FileSystemException. In the other case calls Throwable.getLocalizedMessage().

        Parameters:
        e - the exception.
        Returns:
        a message, won't be null.

      • readWhole

        public static String readWhole(InputStream is,
               String charset)
                        throws IOException,
                               FileSystemException
        Read the whole content of an input stream and returns it as a string.

        To be used for small files.

        Parameters:
        is - an input stream
        charset - The encoding type used to convert bytes from the stream into characters.
        Returns:
        the read string
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs. call Throwable.getMessage() to get the error cause.
        FileSystemException - if a file system exception occurs. Note: FileSystemException.getMessage() usually does not return a user friendly message. Call getLocalizedMessage(FileSystemException) to get a user friendly error message.

      • readWhole

        public static String readWhole(Path file,
               String charset)
                        throws IOException,
                               FileSystemException
        Read the whole content of a file and returns it as a string.

        To be used for small files.

        Parameters:
        file - a file path.
        charset - The encoding type used to convert bytes from the stream into characters.
        Returns:
        the read string
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs. call Throwable.getMessage() to get the error cause.
        FileSystemException - if a file system exception occurs. Note: FileSystemException.getMessage() usually does not return a user friendly message. Call getLocalizedMessage(FileSystemException) to get a user friendly error message.
